meanings.definition: Not loaded or carrying a load.
meanings.sent1: The truck was completely unloaded after delivering the packages.
meanings.sent2: The shelves were empty as all the boxes had been unloaded.
meanings.sent3: The backpack felt so light and unloaded, it was like floating on air.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt unloaded after a relaxing day at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The room looked spacious and unloaded without any furniture.

meanings.sent1: The soldier made sure his gun was unloaded before cleaning it.
meanings.sent2: The police officer checked that the firearm was unloaded before storing it.
meanings.sent3: The toy gun was safely unloaded to prevent any accidents.
meanings.sent4: The hunter always double-checks that his rifle is unloaded when not in use.
meanings.sent5: The shooting range required all weapons to be unloaded when not in use.

meanings.sent1: She felt so much lighter and unloaded after letting go of unnecessary worries.
meanings.sent2: The hiker felt free and unloaded with just a small backpack on his shoulders.
meanings.sent3: His heart felt unloaded when he forgave those who had wronged him.
meanings.sent4: The burden of guilt was finally unloaded from his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of relief was immense as he unloaded the weight of expectations.

meanings.sent1: After a long meditation session, she felt completely unloaded and at peace.
meanings.sent2: He needed some time alone to feel emotionally unloaded and balanced again.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show left everyone feeling emotionally unloaded from all the laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt unloaded after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent5: The therapy session helped him feel emotionally unloaded from past traumas.
